faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
*First-order logic and relational algebra
*Functional and inclusion dependencies
*Conjunctive queries and their optimisation
*Algorithms for conjunctive query evaluation
description.et:
Esimese järgu loogika ja relatsioonialgebra
Funktsionaalsed ja kaasamispiirangud
Konjunktiivsed päringud ja nende optimeerimine
Algoritmid konjunktiivsete päringute hindamiseks

objectives.en: The aim of this course is to study the mathematical principles that dictate the limits and possibilities of database systems. By understanding these principles, students will be prepared to comprehend both current and future advancements in the field. First, the course covers fundamental features of the relational model such as relational algebra, first-order logic, and integrity constraints. Then, the course presents conjunctive queries focusing on their complexity, optimisation, and fast evaluation with classical and modern algorithms.
objectives.et: Selle kursuse eesmärk on uurida matemaatilisi põhimõtteid, mis määravad andmebaasisüsteemide piirid ja võimalused. Nende põhimõtete mõistmine valmistab tudengeid ette mõistma nii praegusi kui ka tulevasi edusamme selles valdkonnas. Esmalt käsitletakse kursusel relatsioonilise mudeli põhifunktsioone, nagu relatsioonialgebra, esimese järgu loogika ja terviklikkuse piirangud. Seejärel tutvustatakse kursusel konjunktiivseid päringuid, keskendudes nende keerukusele, optimeerimisele ja kiirele hindamisele klassikaliste ja kaasaegsete algoritmidega.

learning_outcomes.en: Basics of the relational model and integrity constraints
Connection between descriptive and procedural query languages
learning_outcomes.et: Seos kirjeldavate ja protseduuriliste päringukeelte vahel

learning_outcomes.en: Power and complexity of query languages

topic.et: Course info and the relational model
First-order logic finished. Relational algebra started
Relational algebra finished. Core fragment of SQL started.
Core fragment of SQL finished. "Relational algebra = First-order logic" started. We covered the translation from RA to FO today.
Translation from FO to RA. Homomorphisms.
Functional dependencies and the chase (cont. next week).
Containment and Equivalence. Core and Minimization defined.
Core and Minimization finished (skipped the details of Proposition 3). Hypergraphs and acyclic CQs.
Evaluation of ACQs (skipped proof details). Edge covers and fractional edge covers started.
Worst-case optimal join algorithms. AEJoin algorithm (skipped the details of its correctness and time complexity).
